external.translation[0].definitions[0].d: relating to the outside of something or of a person’s body
external.translation[0].definitions[0].n: For external use only (=written on medicines which must be put on your skin and not swallowed)
external.translation[0].definitions[0].e: the external appearance of the building
external.translation[0].definitions[0].n: In everyday English, people usually say outside rather than external:
The outside walls of the building were painted yellow.
external.translation[0].definitions[1].d: relating to your environment or situation, rather than to your own qualities, ideas etc
external.translation[0].definitions[1].e: Low birth weight may be caused by external factors, such as smoking during pregnancy.
external.translation[0].definitions[2].d: coming from or happening outside a particular place or organization
external.translation[0].definitions[3].e: China will not tolerate any external interference in its affairs.
external.translation[0].definitions[4].d: coming from outside a particular school, university, or organization, and therefore independent
external.translation[0].definitions[4].n: external auditors (=someone from outside who looks at an organization’s finances)
external.translation[1].definitions[0].d: coming from outside a company, organization, or country
external.translation[1].definitions[0].e: Domestic demand fell in the latest quarter, while external demand rose.
